claim: Flublok contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain vs 15 mcg of HA per strain in a standard-dose influenza vaccine.

combined_evidence.quote: For the 2024-2025 influenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains: A/West Virginia 30 2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm 09 like virus) (H1 N1), A/Massachusetts/18/ 2022 (H3 N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote explicitly states that Flublok contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of hemagglutinin (HA) per strain, directly supporting the claim about Flublok's HA content.

combined_evidence.quote: Across three clinical trials (Studies 2 - 4, Tables 2 and 3) a total of 2050 adults age 50 years and older received Flublok and 2048 received a U.S.-licensed trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (IIV3) comparator.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote establishes that the comparator in the studies is a standard-dose influenza vaccine, which is relevant for comparing the HA content per strain between Flublok and standard-dose vaccines.

combined_evidence.quote: Study 2 (NCT00539864) included 602 subjects 50 through 64 years of age for safety analysis, randomized to receive Flublok (n=300) or another U.S.-licensed trivalent influenza vaccine (Fluzone, manufactured by SanofiPasteur, Inc.) as an active control (n=302) (2). Study 3 (NCT00395174) included 869 subjects aged 65 years and older for safety analysis, randomized to receive Flublok (n=436) or another U.S.-licensed trivalent influenza vaccine (Fluzone as an active control (n=433) (3).
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote further clarifies that the standard-dose comparator is Fluzone, a commonly used trivalent influenza vaccine, which is known to contain 15 mcg of HA per strain, supporting the comparison in the claim.

combined_evidence.quote: Flublok [Influenza Vaccine] is a sterile clear colorless injection containing recombinant hemagglutinin (HA) proteins from three influenza viruses for intramuscular use. It contains purified HA proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) that is derived from Sf9 cells of the fall army worm, Spodoptera frugiperda (which is related to moths, caterpillars and butterflies), and grown in serum free medium composed of chemically defined lipids, vitamins, amino acids, and mineral salts. Each of the three HAs is expressed in this cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography. The purified HAs are then blended and filled into single dose syringes. Flublok is standardized according to United States Public Health Service (USPHS) requirements. For the 2024-2025 influenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains: A/West Virginia/30/2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm09-like virus) (H1N1), A/Massachusetts/18/2022 (H3N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote provides a detailed description of Flublok's composition, explicitly stating that it contains 45 mcg of HA per strain for each of the three influenza virus strains, directly supporting the claim about its HA content.

combined_evidence.quote: A single 0.5 mL dose of Flublok contains sodium chloride (4.4 mg), monobasic sodium phosphate (0.2 mg), dibasic sodium phosphate (0.5 mg), and polysorbate 20 (Tween 20) (27.5 mcg). Each 0.5 mL dose of Flublok may also contain residual amounts of baculovirus and Spodoptera frugiperda cell proteins (≤14.3 mcg), baculovirus and cellular DNA (≤10 ng), and Triton X-100 (≤100 mcg). Flublok contains no egg proteins, antibiotics, or preservatives. The single dose, prefilled syringes contain no natural rubber latex.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: While this quote does not directly compare Flublok to standard-dose vaccines, it provides the precise formulation details for a single dose of Flublok, which is relevant for confirming the HA content per dose as part of the claim.
